thread.title: Reports: Don Mattingly out as Los Angeles Dodgers manager
thread.title_full: Reports: Don Mattingly out as Los Angeles Dodgers manager

author: syracuse.com | The Post-Standard
title: Reports: Don Mattingly out as Los Angeles Dodgers manager
text:
Don Mattingly will not return as manager of the Los Angeles Dodgers, according to several reports . 
A person familiar with decision told the Associated Press that Mattingly is out. 
The Los Angeles Times reports it was a mutual decision and was "amicable". 
The Dodgers won three consecutive National League West championships for the first time in franchise history under Mattingly. 
But even with baseball's biggest payroll the club never advanced to the World Series, losing in the division series twice and league championship series once. 
Sources told ESPN's Ramona Shelburne that several teams -- including the Miami Marlins -- would be interested in Mattingly. 
Shelburne reports the Dodgers offered him an extension this past weekend. But that "after years of uncertainty about the Dodgers' long-term commitment to him -- Mattingly has worked under two different ownership groups and two different general managers -- he informed the team earlier this week that he preferred to move on." 
Los Angeles was 446-363 under Mattingly, finishing with a winning record in every season and winning the last three NL West titles. But the Dodgers have not reached the World Series since winning the championship in 1988. 
The 54-year-old former Yankees star ranks sixth in wins among Dodgers managers. He was a holdover from the previous front office regime, having been manager Joe Torre's hand-picked successor in 2010 after he coached under the Hall of Famer for seven seasons in New York and Los Angeles. 
The franchise with baseball's highest payroll, a record $289.6 million as of the end of the regular season, managed just two playoff victories before losing 3-2 to the New York Mets in a decisive Game 5 of their NL Division Series last week. 
Information from the Associated Press was used in this report
